DataElement.preferredName: Chimerism Laboratory Procedure Host Cell Examined Total Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value related to the total number of host cells examined on the chimerism study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chimerism Laboratory Procedure Host Cell Examined
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Having been subjected to inspection or evaluation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:Examined; having been subjected to an examination.

Concepts.definition: An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Having been subjected to inspection or evaluation.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Determining the number or amount of something.
